summary: This is a letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim to Judge J. Nathan, detailing ongoing interference with attorney-client communication at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). The letter alleges breaches of confidentiality in video teleconferences, unauthorized third-party access, restrictions on document sharing, and potential recording of privileged communications, severely impacting Maxwell's ability to prepare for trial.

persons.context: The accused in the criminal case S2 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), currently detained at MDC, whose attorney-client communications are allegedly being interfered with by the detention center.

events.title: VTC Monitor Box Issue
events.description: MDC placed the VTC monitor inside a box with a screen, severely impacting Maxwell's ability to see counsel and documents. This issue was later resolved.

events.title: MDC Changes VTC Platform
events.description: MDC Legal informed defense counsel that VTCs must switch from the defense's WebEx platform to a Zoom platform provided by MDC, citing complaints from Maxwell.

events.title: Zoom Room Breach
events.description: Third parties accessed the Zoom room used by Maxwell and her counsel for a VTC session. This breach was reported to and witnessed by MDC staff, including technician Leon.

events.title: Document Sharing Restriction
events.description: During an in-person visit, Sternheim and Maxwell were told they could not pass documents, frustrating the productivity of a four-hour legal visit.

events.title: Concern About VTC Recording
events.description: Defense expressed concern that VTCs between Maxwell and counsel may have been tape recorded by the MDC. Maxwell had reported this concern to MDC staff with no response.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, New York, NY 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) - implied location of Maxwell's detention
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney alleges the MDC is interfering with attorney-client communication by changing VTC platforms, allowing third-party breaches, and restricting document sharing.
On August 12, 2021, third parties accessed the Zoom room used for a privileged attorney-client VTC between Maxwell and her counsel.

Maxwell's ability to prepare for trial is severely hampered by restrictions on the quantity of legal documents she can bring to sessions and the prohibition on reviewing documents during in-person visits.
The defense has raised concerns that VTCs between Maxwell and her counsel may have been recorded by the MDC, a potential violation of her constitutional rights.
The letter requests the court to direct MDC Legal to show cause for the platform change, delays, and to provide a sworn statement regarding interference with privileged communications.
